Olympia Coffee Roasting - El Salvador Ricardo Ariz - Pacamara

This single origin is the product of a close relationship between Olympia Coffee and the grower, Ricardo Ariz. Over the years both have worked together to continue improving everything from the coffee cherries themselves to how the harvested cherries are processed. This varietal in particular takes a lot of extra attention and care, making it also more expensive. For Ricardo, it's all worth it because, put simply, 'It makes an awesome cup'. Enjoy this delicious coffee with us as we continue to follow along on this amazing process.
Olympia Coffee Roasting - Kenya Tegu Reserve

One of the best selections coming from the Tegu Washing Station located close to Mount Kenya, this amazing single origin coffee represents the hard work and dedication of the farmers behind it. As a group the Tegu farmers work to maximize their returns on coffee by working together to raise quality standards. Through continued training and education their efforts pay off year after year and this new crop is no exception. With delicious notes of citrus and summer fruits, this coffee is sure to be a new favorite.
Olympia Coffee Roasting - Ethiopia Banko Natural

Back this season! Intensely fruity and juicy, this single origin coffee is a stunning example of how delicious naturally processed coffee can be. Organic and fair trade, it is grown by the Banko Dhadhato Cooperative in an area where the cooler weather slows the maturation and increases the complexity of flavors resulting in a spectacular cup. One of our favorite seasonal coffees that we look forward to each year!
Olympia Coffee Roasting Big Truck Espresso

Olympia Coffee Roasting Co. devotes constant attention to their favorite espresso blend. The components may change based on the season, but the flavor remains the same. This delicious organic espresso has a dense, velvety body with notes of sweet chocolate and ripe berries.

Our second naturally processed coffee from the Guji/Sidama region of Ethiopia this year! Produced by a privately owned mill with coffees contributed by nearly 700 farmers, only the best coffee cherries were selected for the final, certified Grade 1 product. With strong notes of blueberry and the sweetness of dark chocolate, this coffee is delicious brewed hot or this summer try it brewed over ice for a tasty treat.

You don't need a weathervane to know which direction the wind is blowing for Spotted Cow Coffee's Weathervane blend! With notes of chocolate and berry when brewed with a Chemex, as well as dark chocolate and slight hints of tobacco when brewed with a Technivorm, all winds point to delicious with Spotted Cow's Weathervane blend!
Spotted Cow Coffee Farmhouse Espresso Blend - 12oz

Spotted Cow Coffee's Farmhouse Espresso blend brings the smooth and fruity side of farm living to your freshly brewed espresso. With prominent notes of blueberry and more subtle hints of melon and cherry (thanks SCG tasters!), you may find yourself longing for the laid-back easy lifestyle of good ol' country living.
Living up to its namesake, La Tortuga - the turtle - shows that slow and steady wins the race when it comes to quality coffee production!

Intelligentsia's signature House Blend of Latin American coffees perfect for your morning brew. A beautiful balance of fruit and sweetness, this coffee showcases the flavors of the region while also producing a consistently delicious cup that you can rely on. Approachable for coffee drinkers of all types, notes of milk chocolate and fruit make an amazing pair that is sure to delight.
Intelligentsia Coffee Black Cat Decaffeinated Espresso

Enjoy the flavor, nuance and overall excellence that is Intelligentsia's Black Cat espresso without the jolt of caffeine. Perfect for an afternoon cup, evening dinner party or whenever you need a caffeine break. Sourced and blended with the same dedication as its caffeinated counterparts, this coffee is packed with delicious notes of chocolate, fruit and nuts for a well balanced, delicious cup.
Intelligentsia Coffee Black Cat Analog Espresso

Reminiscent of a classic Italian style espresso, Intelligentsia's Analog blend is known for its smoothness and reliability- both in taste and performance. Designed to be comforting and approachable for coffee drinkers of all types, this blend is versatile enough for everything from a syrupy ristretto to your daily pour over. It also pairs beautifully with milk for a rich velvety latte.
Intelligentsia Coffee Black Cat Classic Espresso

Intelligentsia's flagship espresso, know for it's clean, sweet and complex profile, it demonstrates their foundation and style as a roaster. A mixture of washed and naturally processed coffees sourced for the perfect combination of flavor and texture, this blend is part of their Black Cat Project and is constantly evolving in their quest for excellence. With notes of caramel and citrus it shines beautifully as espresso but can also hold its own when paired with milk in a cappuccino or latte.
Equator Coffee Fair Trade Organic Jaguar Espresso
With rich notes of bittersweet chocolate that are supported by caramel and hazelnut accents, Equator's Jaguar Espresso is sure to please the dark roast lover in your life.

Giving off tastes from all equatorial regions, the Equator Blend will give you a full bodied flavor with a smooth finish. With notes of cedar, almond, berry and nutmeg, it'll be a world party in your mouth.
Equator Coffee Fair Trade Organic Mocha Java

A complex blend of flavors, the Mocha Java hails tastes from the Arabian Peninsula, Africa and Indonesia. With flavors of aged wood, fruit, bittersweet chocolate and spice, this blend has been highly recommended by many reviewers.

A light but fruitful roast, Equator Coffee's Tigerwalk Espresso brings you a tart but sweet espresso blend of beans from Mexico, Guatemala and Rwanda. A balance of sweet and creamy espresso, this blend features a hint of cherry-toned chocolate, strawberries and lemon.
The second natural process coffee ever in Supersonic's line-up! A rare treat that we are excited to share.
A seasonal blend of coffees from two countries, it makes a sweet, luscious espresso with notes of dark chocolate and grapefruit. Paired with steamed milk, it makes a delicious cappuccino or latte.
49th Parallel Coffee- Cascara- Coffee Cherry Tea

Did you know coffee comes from a cherry like fruit? The delicious 'pit' (coffee bean) is removed and processed for roasting, while the fruit is typically used to help renourish the coffee plants. In some parts of the world though, they dry the best fruit husks (cascara in Spanish) and brew them like tea! This particular cascara comes from the Finca La Florida in El Salvador and is dried for 24 hours and carefully sorted. Delicious steeped hot or even cold brewed overnight, we are loving this for summer! Try it as iced tea, an Arnold Palmer or maybe even a mixed drink for a unique treat!

Another shining example of Honduran coffee to be enjoyed this season. Produced by a small farm that only recently took the steps to make sure their coffee was appreciated for its amazing quality and uniquness. This marks only the third season that their coffee is being sold to specialty roasters, like 49th Parallel, and we can't wait to see what the future holds for this growing farm. With notes of stone fruit and berries, this coffee is a special treat that really stands out from the rest.

Grown in a region known for its fertile clay soil, this single origin coffee is a stellar example from Kenya. The coffee cherries ripen slowly in the shade of eucalyptus and other indigenous trees giving the resulting coffee beans a vibrant fruity flavor profile. Combine that with the amazing attention to detail that the members of the Muburi cooperative give each step of the process and we get to enjoy an truly exceptional cup!

The result of 49th Parallel's search for the best, sweetest espresso, Epic Espresso is just that... epic! Roasted lighter than most espresso blends to showcase the floral notes and bright acidity, this coffee is noted for is complexity and balance of acidity and sweetness. 49th Parallel is constantly working to improve its excellence, which is shown in the quality of your cup. Enjoy!

Perfect for all types of brewed coffee, this seasonal blend provides a clean cup with sweet notes of caramel. Blended with only the freshest coffees each season, Longitude 123 Degrees W is sure to be a crowd pleaser no matter how you brew it. You may even want to try experimenting with it as espresso, we won't judge.

Well balanced, heavy bodied espresso with delicate floral sweetness and a buttery caramel mouthfeel. A delicious organic espresso to sit back and enjoy- perfect for shots of espresso or mixed with your favorite frothed milk.

Delicious notes of juicy blueberry and blackberry melt into flavors of hazelnut, chocolate and brown sugar with a buttery mouthfeel. This complex blend is both intense and satisfying as the components work together harmoniously.
Velton's Coffee - Treehouse Drip Blend Coffee

Velton's Treehouse Blend Coffee is produced by a small roastery focused on quality control at every turn. Only the highest quality beans are considered. All of Velton's coffee is roasted in small batches, hand blended, and promptly packaged in the highest quality bags (with one-way degassing valve) to ensure maximum freshness.

Try a sip of Seattle, embodied in Caffe Ladro's signature espresso blend. Ladro Espresso is a little spot of sunshine on a stormy day. By itself it is creamy and sweet with mild chocolate flavor. In a milk-based drink it adds layers of flavor without the addition of sweetener or syrups. It makes a balanced espresso or a full-bodied drip coffee.
Anchorhead Coffee Narwhal House Blend - Whole Bean - 10oz

Anchorhead's signature house blend- this coffee will greet you with a the pleasant aroma of ripe cherry. This translates beautifully to your cup where you will also find notes a rich chocolate and creamy nougat. Reminiscent of an old school favorite treat- cherry cordial- this blend is truly a delight.
Slate Coffee Roasters Cream and Sugar Drip Coffee Blend

Put down the cream and toss the sugar, because Slate Coffee's Cream and Sugar drip coffee blend has arrived to be your everything. For those that have been considering giving up the extras and switching to strictly coffee, Slate's Cream and Sugar blend is a good place to start! Roasted to be an easy drinking coffee, you may detect hints of dark chocolate, toasted almond and sweet caramel through this crowd pleaser.

A delicious blend with a flavor profile that takes you back in time with notes of brown sugar, clove and peach. It has a dense sweetness and complexity that is perfect when paired with milk or even as espresso.

Deliciously sweet, this clean low-acid coffee is named not for its difficulty to brew, but for the challenge the Counter Culture coffee buyers face in sourcing just the right beans for this blend. Designed to remind you of a traditional Italian espresso, Big Trouble combines those chocolatey, nutty flavors loved by so many to create an amazing cup no matter how it is brewed- pour over, french press, espresso- choose your favorite!

Developed to introduce coffee drinkers to new coffees from Latin America, Counter Culture's Fast Forward is a blend only the freshest coffees specially selected for a sweet and nutty flavor profile. For those coffee drinkers that like coffee with a little lighter body and a simple consistency to their brew.

A seasonal blend of coffees that is sourced and roasted to be approachable for coffee drinkers that enjoy espresso or brewed coffee. Sweet and full-bodied with notes of chocolate and fruit, it is sure to be a crowd pleaser or a delicious everyday cup.
Velton's Coffee - Three Ravens Blend - Decaf Espresso

Velton's Three Ravens Blend Decaf Espresso is produced by a small roastery focused on quality control at every turn. Only the highest quality beans are considered. All of Velton's coffee is roasted in small batches, hand blended, and promptly packaged in the highest quality bags (with one-way degassing valve) to ensure maximum freshness.
Middle Fork Roasters Back Pedal Brew - Whole Bean
Back Pedal Brew by Middle Fork Roasters is a blend of Brazilian and Sumatran coffee beans. This popular medium roast coffee has a sweet floral finish with rich bourbon and molasses undertones.

Lavazza Crema e Aroma is a creamy and aromatic coffee blend with delicious aroma, smooth flavor and consistent long-lasting crema. Lavazza's premium coffee blends Central and South American Arabicas with select Robustas from Africa to create a full-flavored coffee.

Caffe Espresso is coming to the rescue of dark roast loving, superautomatic using, coffee drinkers everywhere! While a medium roast coffee, it is Lavazza's darkest roast and these darker tendencies produce a rich body with a fragrant aroma. The 100% Arabica blend from Central and South America makes it ideal for espresso (superautomatic or otherwise!), but will create a delicious cup o' coffee with any preparation method. So, what are you waiting for? Show the world your darker side...of coffee, that is!

Qualita Oro Espresso is the signature Lavazza blend of 100% Arabica, combining prestigious coffees from Central America with some African varieties chosen for their intense aroma. Qualita Oro has a cup character that is mellow with a pleasant floral hint, typical of the Central American coffee origins.

Lavazza Dek Decaf Espresso Whole Bean coffee offers a well-balanced blend from Asia. Full-bodied, long-lasting flavor for those who want to avoid caffeine without giving up delicious Italian coffee. Lavazza uses a modern process of decaffeination with carbon dioxide that does not diminish the flavor and aroma of the roasted coffee beans, a potential downfall of the Swiss water process. The use of carbon dioxide and pure water also avoids the use of potentially harmful substances in the decaffeination process. What to expect from Lavazza's Dek Decaf? A medium-bodied, full flavored espresso roast with no bitter aftertaste. Amaze your friends and family, they won't believe it is decaffeinated. Try a taste test and see! Dek Decaf beans also blend well with your favorite roast to create a custom 50/50 half decaf option.

Lavazza Pienaroma Espresso is a 100% Arabica blend from the finest premium Arabicas grown in Brazil, the Caribbean and Central America. It produces a creamy, smooth coffee with a sweet and pleasantly acidic body. The low caffeine content and delicate flavor make Pienaroma easy to drink without additives like milk or sugar. It works well as an after dinner coffee and is delicious when paired with desserts.

Lavazza Top Class is a full-bodied espresso coffee with a very intense and persistent aftertaste. This select blend of fine Arabicas and special washed Robustas from Java results in a rich flavor and aroma. It makes a dense crema, enjoyable whether you sip espresso or milky cappuccinos.

Lavazza Gran Espresso blend is made with Arabica beans from Central and South America, combined with African and Indonesian Robustas. Consistent cup after cup, Lavazza Gran Espresso is strong... but not to be confused with dark and oily, this is light and flavorful.

Lavazza Qualita Rossa Espresso is a full bodied espresso. The African Robusta coffee beans give it body and a chocolate aroma, while the natural Arabica from the Brazilian highlands contribute body and a mild aroma. Lavazza roasting brings it all together to create a velvety sensation for your palette. It is the perfect blend for breakfast because it goes well with milk-based drinks and is excellent with biscotti or other bakery goodies.
illy Monoarabica - Single Origin Whole Bean Coffee - Guatemala

Illy Caffe procures sustainably grown Arabica beans exclusively from the Huehuetenango region of Guatemala. The western highlands of Guatemala are a well-know coffee producing area, and these specialty beans add a hint of sweet and spiciness to many existing coffee blends. On its own as a 100% single origin product it is easy to discern sweet flavors in tandem with a barely perceptible chipotle undertone in this lightly roasted full-bodied coffee. It makes a smooth cup with no bitterness.
illy Monoarabica - Single Origin Whole Bean Coffee - Ethiopia

Illy Caffe takes Arabica beans grown exclusively in the Yirgacheffe region of Eastern Ethiopia and roasts them on their own to highlight their unique flavor profile, while also adding aroma to many existing coffee blends. On their own they shine as a 100% single origin product and it is easy to discern citrus notes of lemons and limes in the aroma of this lightly roasted medium-bodied coffee.
Zoka Coffee - Zoka Java Coffee Blend

Zoka Coffee brings a new twist to the classic Mocha Java blend in their signature Zoka Java interpretation. As one of the most well known and historic coffee blends, how does Zoka Coffee, a small artisan roaster in Seattle, improve upon perfection? Zoka took the flavor profile and re-imagined it with what is available now in sustainable agriculture. Instead of coffee from the island of Java, they found a savory, syrupy source in Indonesia. For the bright fruit forward component they bypassed Yemen in favor of Ethiopia. If you are not familiar with the flavor, Zoka Java has a balanced flavor: full earthy body, moderate acidity, nut-like chocolaty flavors and fruity floral high notes.

In a town known for deep dark drip coffee, Zoka Coffee created a standout in Fitzroy's Blend. It has the requisite notes of intense dark chocolate and smoke, but transformed into a medium-bodied coffee. There is a fine acidity present with a sweet and persistent aftertaste.

Zoka Coffee's Tuscan Blend is a dark roast with smoky, dark chocolate notes and a sweet finish. It is smooth (smooooth, perhaps with 4 O's for emphasis) with no bitterness and has quite a caffeinated kick at the end. It makes for a perfect afternoon pick-me-up for those who need a little extra help getting through the day.
